data.name: List Height Level
data.description:
Write a function that given a list (which may contain lists inside with more lists inside and so on), returns its maximum height.

When lists are seen as n-ary trees, with the outer list as the root, it makes sense to define the height as the number of nodes in the path from the root to the farthest node.  And with this definition an empty list will have a height of 1.

| List | height |
| ---- | --- |
| `[]` | 1 |
| `[[]]` | 2 |
| `[[[]]]` | 3 |
| `[[[[]]]]` | 4 |
| `[[[[[]]]]]` | 5 |
| `[[], []]` | 2 |
| `[[], [], [], [], []]` | 2 |
| `[[], [], [], [[]], []]` | 3 |
| `[[], [], [], [[[]]], []]` | 4 |

Note: the lists will only contain lists inside, nothing but lists so there's no need to check for other types of values, and you can assume this for niftier implementations.
